subject: Web3
title: The Binance Settlement
description: A quick, practical guide to The Binance Settlement.

hook.text: In 2023, Binance CEO Changpeng Zhao pleaded guilty to violating anti-money laundering laws. The fine: $4.3 billion.

buildup.text: Binance, the world's largest crypto exchange, had processed transactions for sanctioned entities including North Korea and Iran.

discovery.text: Zhao admitted Binance prioritized growth over compliance. The exchange knowingly served US customers without proper licensing.

twist.text: Zhao stepped down as CEO but Binance continued operating. The exchange was too big and too globally connected to shut down.

climax.text: The $4.3 billion fine was the largest in crypto history. It proved that even the biggest players face consequences.

punchline.text: The biggest exchange. The biggest fine. Size doesn't mean immunity.

quiz.question: Why was Binance fined $4.3 billion?
options: For violating anti-money laundering laws and serving sanctioned entities
